abstract: The European Central Bank and Swiss National Bank said Monday that they would end a program aimed at supplying Swiss currency to banks, in a further sign that the region’s financial system is becoming more stable.
snippet: The European Central Bank and Swiss National Bank said Monday that they would end a program aimed at supplying Swiss currency to banks, in a further sign that the region’s financial system is becoming more stable.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank and Swiss National Bank said Monday that they would end a program aimed at supplying Swiss currency to banks, in a further sign that the region’s financial system is becoming more stable, The New York Times’s Jack Ewing reported.

headline.main: European Banks Take a Step Toward More Normal Lending
